metadata.description: SpruceID lets users control their data across the web. Instead of people signing into platforms, we imagine platforms should sign into people’s data vaults. We implement this pattern into digital wallet ecosystems for governments, enterprises, and blockchains. We believe that architectures that enable individual autonomy in the digital world are necessary for free societies and dynamic economies to thrive.
metadata.founder_1_description: None
metadata.founder_2_description:
Brooklyn native. 

Hi – my name is Rocco. I’m a digital humanist and Joycean by education, a musician by practice, and a technologist by trade. I am a co-founder of Spruce. In a past life, I was an associate producer for a children’s media company, an editor in chief and journalist, a startup consultant on product and strategy, and eventually a strategy lead for a team at ConsenSys focused on digital identity.
metadata.generated_description:
**SpruceID Overview: Mastering Digital Identity Control**

Founded in 2020 and part of Y Combinator's W21 batch, SpruceID is based in New York and has quickly gathered a talented team of 25. Their mission? To empower individuals to take control of their personal data across the web. Think of it as shifting the power dynamic: instead of users logging into various platforms, platforms should gain access to their data vaults. This twist on digital identity positions SpruceID not just as a product but as a critical building block for a free society in the digital age.

### What They Do 

SpruceID's offerings include a suite of products designed for the issuance and verification of digital credentials. Their flagship product, **Credible**, is a robust end-to-end solution for verifiable identities—think of digital driver's licenses and other necessary credentials in our increasingly digital world. They also provide **SpruceKit**, an open-source library to help developers integrate these capabilities into their applications.

#### Key Solutions:
- **Issuance**: Digital IDs, passes, permits, and supply chain credentials.
- **Verification**: Secure methods for online and in-person checks of digital credentials.

### Industry Reach

SpruceID isn’t just targeting a single market; their solutions are applicable across several sectors including government, healthcare, education, financial services, marketplaces, and the emerging Web3 space. This versatility not only broadens their impact but also reinforces the importance of privacy and individual autonomy in those domains.

### The Foundation of Their Mission

At SpruceID, privacy-by-design is not just a buzzword—it's embedded in their architecture. They believe in creating frameworks that enhance individual autonomy, a necessity for fostering dynamic economies and vibrant, free societies. Their journey has led them to partner with notable organizations, including the California DMV for mobile driver's licenses, showcasing their expertise in crafting secure and user-friendly digital identities.

### The Big Picture

As we navigate an age where AI can easily generate fake identities, SpruceID addresses the looming identity crisis head-on. Their techniques and security features are designed to withstand these challenges, ensuring genuine interactions in the digital realm.

In essence, SpruceID is redefining how we perceive and handle digital identity. Their vision transcends mere technology; it's about ensuring that people retain control over their identities, a principle that resonates deeply in today’s fast-evolving digital landscape.

For more information, visit their website at [SpruceID.com](https://www.spruceid.com).
metadata.headline: SpruceID lets users control their data across the web.
metadata.name: SpruceID

metadata.description:
Trendex is a platform for fan engagement that enables billions of fans to actively follow the careers of top athletes and emerging talents.

This is achieved through digital limited edition cards created and owned by the athletes themselves, with their value linked to their performance. Fans can purchase, trade, and utilize these cards on the Trendex platform, connecting with their idols more than ever before. Unlike existing trading cards, on Trendex, the stars and emerging talents create their own cards, making them truly official, uniquely limited, and directly tied to their careers and success.

With Trendex, you have the opportunity to get involved early in the careers of promising athletes and actively engage with their daily performances through virtual competitions based on the real-life achievements of the talents you own.
metadata.founder_1_description:
I am passionate about software engineering and game development since 12, graduating as an engineer in 2014.

In 2015, I launched a GUI-based Ethereum mining app called GoldMiner. Then worked as an advisor and consultant for many companies in the payments, finance and art sectors.

Passionate about FinTech and Blockchain solutions, I now focus my expertise on Trendex.
metadata.founder_2_description: Jean-Joseph has extensive experience in legal and consulting. He managed operations for large and mid-size business across Europe helping them scale while maintaining them focused, goal oriented and disciplined.
metadata.generated_description:
**Trendex - Own the Stars: Unlocking Fan Engagement Through Unique Digital Cards**

**Overview**  
Founded in 2021 and situated in Paris, France, Trendex is part of Y Combinator's Batch S22, showing it's got the backing of one of the best startup accelerators out there. The company's mission is clear: transform billions of fans into active participants in the exciting journeys of top athletes and up-and-coming talents.

**What They Do**  
Trendex revolves around fan engagement using digital limited edition cards, which athletes create and own themselves. This isn’t your typical trading card setup; these cards’ value is directly tied to the athletes’ performance. Fans have the chance to purchase, trade, and utilize these unique cards on the Trendex platform, allowing them to connect with their sports idols more intimately than ever before.

**How It Works**  
1. **Build Your Collection**: Users can choose from over 200 talents across various sports and entertainment sectors, including soccer and basketball. You're not just collecting cards; you're curating a roster of potential champions.
   
2. **Track Performance**: Each talent gets a performance score that reflects their real-world success. This score guides fans in building the best possible team.
   
3. **Compete**: Trendex organizes competitions where fans can showcase their teams. The better your chosen athletes perform, the more you win. Prizes include signed jerseys, unique experiences, and gift cards.
   
4. **Support Talent**: Trendex commits a substantial portion of its profits to assist emerging athletes, reinforcing the bond between the stars and their supporters.

**Current Momentum**  
Trendex has already made waves with notable figures, like NBA defender Marcus Smart, joining the platform. They’ve distributed over $500,000 in prizes, attracted 75,000+ users, and partnered with big names supported by millions of fans. 

**The Team**  
With a small but focused team of nine, Trendex is lean and agile, able to pivot quickly in the fast-paced landscape of fintech, sports-tech, and gaming.

**Why It Matters**  
Trendex isn’t just about collecting cards; it’s about creating a community where fans become stakeholders in the success of their favorite athletes. It’s a novel blend of fandom and financial investment that taps into the growing trend of engagement-driven platforms.

For more information or to dive into the Trendex experience, visit their website at [trendex.tech](https://trendex.tech). 

In short, if you’re a sports fan looking to blend passion with investment, Trendex just might be the game-changer you're waiting for.
metadata.headline: Transforming billions of fans into active participants in the journeyâ¦
metadata.name: Trendex - Own the stars

Founder at FamPay (YC S19) 
Building the future of payments for teenagers in India
metadata.founder_2_description: Kush is the founder and co-CEO of FamPay - one of the largest fintechs in India processing 100M txs/ month and is designed exclusively for GenZs and GenAlphas. Theyâre backed by YC, Sequoia, GC and have raised $42M. FamPay is doing great and is taking significant market share. Kush is quite bullish on the generation born in 21st century. He is also recognised by Forbes 30 under 30. Other than fintech, Kush is passionate about the intersection of education, health and technology.
metadata.generated_description:
### FamPay: Pioneering Teen Financial Inclusion in India

**Overview:**
Founded in **2019** and based in **Bengaluru**, India, FamPay is carving a unique niche in the fintech sector by being India’s first **neobank for teenagers**. This innovative platform allows minors to make electronic payments—like UPI (Unified Payments Interface), peer-to-peer (P2P) transfers, and even card payments—without the hassle of a traditional bank account. Essentially, FamPay helps parents transfer money to their kids securely, letting the younger generation spend under their supervision while paving the way for financial literacy.

**Mission:**
FamPay's mission is straightforward yet compelling: **to make payments smooth and enjoyable for children**. By doing so, they’re not just facilitating transactions; they’re empowering the next generation to understand and manage money effectively.

**Key Features:**
1. **Spending Account**: FamPay’s offering, known as **FamX**, allows users aged 11 and above to open a spending account that simplifies financial interactions. 
2. **UPI Payments**: The platform enables transactions that are almost instantaneous, boasting payment times of less than 2 seconds—talk about a frictionless experience!
3. **Custom Features**: Kids can personalize their experience with custom UPI IDs and cards, including a one-of-a-kind “doodle card” option that encourages creativity.
4. **Rewards System**: Regular spenders can earn cashback and discounts through FamCoins on various transactions, incentivizing financial responsibility.
5. **24/7 Support**: FamPay’s commitment extends to customer service, providing help whenever needed.

**Growth and Impact:**
With a team of 24 dedicated employees, FamPay has already garnered over **10 million registered users**, reflecting its strong market penetration and trust from both teenagers and parents alike. The platform also has strong backing from notable investors, including **Y Combinator**, providing a solid foundation for future growth and innovation.

**What Sets Them Apart?**
FamPay taps into a demographic that has largely been overlooked by banks and traditional financial institutions. By creating a bridge between parents and children regarding money management, they are pioneering a new way for teens to learn about spending, saving, and financial independence. 

**Conclusion:**
In a world where financial technology is rapidly evolving, FamPay stands out not just for what it offers but for the societal change it aims to induce. It’s reshaping how young people in India engage with money, ensuring they are not just passive users but educated participants in their financial futures. They are not just a fintech enterprise; they are a part of a movement towards smarter, well-informed financial habits for the youth.

For more information, visit their website at [FamPay](https://fampay.in).
metadata.headline: Indiaâs first neobank for teenagers
metadata.name: FamPay

metadata.description:
SafetyKit replaces human Trust and Safety reviewers with language models.

We make it easy for enterprise Trust and Safety teams to supercharge their content review workflows — speeding up agent decision-making 5x or by automating the review altogether — and significantly reduce operations costs with faster, more accurate decisions.

With SafetyKit, Trust and Safety teams write their policies in natural language and use them to detect and action nefarious content, instantly.  Each decision is accompanied by an explanation grounded in your policies — not a generic definition or model score.  We allow TnS teams to confidently scale their capacity, freeing up your agents for the highest leverage work, while reducing those agents exposure to problematic content.
metadata.founder_1_description: David led engineering for risk reviews at Stripe for fraud, credit, content moderation, and financial crimes. He built the policy and workflow engine that scaled Stripe from internal reviewers to thousands of outsourced vendor agents.
metadata.founder_2_description:
Steven is a cofounder of SafetyKit, working to replace human trust and safety reviewers with language models.

Previously he worked at Carbic as the first software engineer and later as the CEO. There he helped build ultrasonic flow sensors which were installed on oil pipelines and offshore rigs around the world.

Steven also cofounded Thomas Street, a software design and engineering consultancy, where he worked with companies like Cisco, Roche, and DirecTV.
metadata.generated_description:
**SafetyKit**  
*Empowering Trust and Safety with AI*

**Overview**: Founded in 2023 and nestled in the tech-savvy heart of San Francisco, SafetyKit is revolutionizing how enterprises handle trust and safety management. Backed by Y Combinator’s Batch S23, this nimble startup is on a mission to ditch the outdated reliance on human reviewers by introducing an AI-powered solution that automates the content review process.

**Mission**: SafetyKit aims to enhance trust and safety automation through cutting-edge language models, enabling teams to scale their operations and reduce costs. By crafting policies in natural language, Trust and Safety (TnS) teams can swiftly detect and take action against harmful content, all while providing clear, policy-grounded explanations for every decision made.

**Key Features**:
- **Speed & Efficiency**: Amplifies decision-making efficiency by 5x or even removes the need for human intervention altogether.
- **Human-Level Accuracy**: Capable of processing up to 20,000 reviews per minute, ensuring 100% adherence to defined policies.
- **Contextual Understanding**: Unlike generic models, SafetyKit takes into account the entire context, including text and multimedia, offering nuanced understanding for complex situations.
- **Policy-Backed Decisions**: All actions are documented with detailed explanations, thus ensuring a transparent and accountable review process.

**Use Cases**:
- Enforcing marketplace rules to keep prohibited goods off platforms.
- Automating user report handling to identify issues proactively, mitigating potential escalations.
- Ensuring user-generated content meets stringent safety standards without costly human oversight.

metadata.description: Apozy is a browser defense platform powered by "Native Browser Isolation" technology. It neutralizes phishing, malware, and impersonation attacks in real-time by sandboxing dangerous websites at the time of click. This creates a safe "read-only" environment for browsing, even if the original website is malicious. Businesses use Apozy Airlock to protect their employees from online threats and prevent data breaches.
metadata.generated_description:
Apozy is a San Francisco-based company that aims to make every website safe to browse. Founded in 2017 and a member of Y Combinator's Winter 2017 batch, Apozy is primarily a browser defense platform utilizing "Native Browser Isolation" technology. This technology can neutralize phishing, malware, and impersonation attacks in real time by sandboxing potentially harmful websites just as users click on them. Essentially, it creates a safe "read-only" environment, which is crucial even if the original site is malicious.

The flagship product, Apozy Airlock, is used by businesses to protect their employees from online threats and to prevent data breaches—an increasing concern in today’s digital landscape. With a small but effective team of 9 employees, Apozy prioritizes creating a robust, user-friendly platform that not only blocks unsafe content but also provides a frictionless experience for users. The team is backed by NaN as their Group Partner.

Their platform serves multiple functions including:
- **Native Browser Isolation** 
- **Central Ad Block** 
- **Instant Deployment** 
- **Data Access & Insight** via features like "See Behind URLs."

The platform stands out by ensuring that businesses can deploy these features rapidly—often in under a minute—without complex setups. They also offer a powerful API that lets developers integrate comprehensive URL threat detection into their existing applications.

Apozy has positioned itself as a reliable security solution, emphasizing ease of use and minimal disruption to workflow. Its leadership garners recognition for maintaining near-zero false positives in phishing detection, making it a trusted partner for many targeted companies globally.

If you’re interested in knowing more about their offerings, you can visit [Apozy's website](https://www.apozy.com/), or request a demo to see their technology in action. metadata.generated_description:
**IOMETE: Redefining Data Management**

Founded in 2020 and proudly part of Y Combinator’s W22 batch, IOMETE has carved out a niche as a self-hosted data lakehouse platform. Located in Mountain View, California, with a compact but mighty team of 12, IOMETE is on a mission to simplify data handling across various environments—be it on-premises, public cloud, or private cloud. Their platform is designed for large-scale analytics, allowing businesses to seamlessly integrate and analyze all their data while ensuring robust security and ownership.

### What is IOMETE?

IOMETE’s unique selling point is providing a unified data experience. Unlike many traditional platforms that lock users into costly subscriptions and cloud dependencies—complete with the risks of data breaches—IOMETE runs directly within the customer's infrastructure. This model empowers users with full data ownership and privacy while drastically reducing costs. It embodies a modern approach to leveraging and securing data, making it an appealing alternative to existing giants like Snowflake, Databricks, and Cloudera.

### Core Features

1. **Data Integration:** IOMETE allows for smooth synchronization from a wide range of data sources. This includes everything from operational databases to IoT devices, making it adaptable to any enterprise's unique data landscape.

2. **Real-time Analytics:** The platform is powered by Apache Spark, enabling users to conduct real-time data processing and analytics. The ability to run complex machine learning and AI models on live data opens up new avenues for businesses to glean insights swiftly.

3. **Robust Security:** With certifications that adhere to SOC 2, GDPR, and HIPAA, IOMETE positions itself as a leader in data security. The platform’s architecture ensures that sensitive data stays within the secure perimeter of the enterprise.

4. **Flexible Deployment:** Users can opt for on-premises, hybrid, or full cloud deployment, fostering a customizable experience depending on their technical needs and regulatory environments.

5. **Disruptive Pricing:** IOMETE’s transparent pricing model promises no surprise bills or lock-ins, making it not just a smart choice on paper, but a financially savvy one, too.

### Who's Behind IOMETE?

With backing from investors like Nan and roots in Silicon Valley's vibrant startup ecosystem, IOMETE is at the forefront of data lakehouse innovation. Their approach is particularly suited for enterprises looking to maximize the value of their data while staying compliant with evolving data privacy regulations.

### In Summary

IOMETE isn’t just another data platform; it's a revolutionary approach to data management that champions user empowerment, security, and adaptability. If you’re tired of complex, high-cost data solutions that leave you exposed and frustrated, IOMETE offers a refreshing alternative that combines the best of analytics with the peace of mind that your data is secure and under your control.

For more insights, explore their [website](https://www.iomete.com/) to discover how IOMETE can transform your data strategy.
metadata.headline: The Self-hosted Data Lakehouse Platform
metadata.name: IOMETE

We build for devs who want to iterate quickly, offering both managed auth and self-hosting. You can set it up in one minute and scale with the project as it grows.

metadata.generated_description:
**Stack Auth: An Open-Source Alternative for Developers**

Founded in 2024 and part of Y Combinator's Batch S24, Stack Auth is revolutionizing the world of authentication and user management. It's essentially an open-source alternative to Auth0, designed specifically for developers who need speed and flexibility in their projects.

### Mission and Vision
Stack Auth encapsulates the idea of building a platform that enhances the way developers manage authentication (authN) and authorization (authZ). The goal? To empower developers with tools that allow them to iterate quickly, whether they prefer managed solutions or self-hosting. At Stack Auth, you can have your user management system set up in just a minute, making it a perfect fit for fast-growing projects.

### What They Offer
- **Ease of Use:** With an emphasis on simplicity, you can install and integrate Stack Auth into any Next.js project without fuss.
- **Managed and Self-Hosted Options:** Developers can choose how they'd like to deploy, whether in-house or using Stack Auth's hosting services.
- **Developer-Centric Features:** They offer support for standards like JWT, SSO, and 2FA, along with robust user management capabilities—all within a developer-friendly interface.

### Robust Functionality
Stack Auth not only manages authentication but also offers seamless integrations for organizations and teams, permissions management, and even webhooks for syncing with tools like Slack and databases. It caters to a variety of user needs with features that are both intuitive and powerful.

### Comparative Advantage
What sets Stack Auth apart from its competitors? It's the combination of being fully open-source, developer-focused, and offering reasonable pricing. Stack Auth appeals to the developer community looking for transparency and control over their authentication systems. It's built for those who want to own their auth solutions rather than being tied to enterprise-level options.

### Community and Growth
Being an open-source project, organic growth is vital for Stack Auth. The feedback from users speaks volumes—developers have reported rapid implementations and high satisfaction thanks to the responsive support team. You can check out their [GitHub](https://github.com/stack-auth/stack) for contributions and to become a part of the community.

### Pricing
They have a straightforward pricing model:
- **Free:** For individuals wanting to self-host.
- **Team Plan:** $49/month for small teams.
- **Growth Plan:** $299/month for larger enterprises needing scalability.

### Conclusion
In a nutshell, Stack Auth is positioning itself as a vital tool for developers looking to simplify their authentication needs without sacrificing control or flexibility. It’s about building with confidence, and if you're in the tech community, it’s worth checking out. To learn more or to get started, visit their [website](https://stack-auth.com). 

This isn’t just about identity management; it’s about empowering developers to take charge of their tech stack. If you’re tired of the cumbersome setups of traditional authentication services, Stack Auth might just be what you’re looking for.
metadata.headline: The open-source Auth0 alternative
metadata.name: Stack Auth

Founded as part of Y Combinator's Batch S12, Mth Sense emerged with a mission to tackle the inefficiencies of "blind" ads—those that lack targeting and relevance for the intended audience.

**What They Offer**  
At the heart of Mth Sense’s offerings is **RevSense**, a sophisticated system that leverages machine learning, big data, and automation to optimize programmatic advertising revenue. With the potential to boost revenue by 20% to 100%, RevSense automatically adjusts ad setups in real-time, optimizing parameters like price floors and frequency caps without manual intervention.

#### Key Features:
1. **Yield Optimization**: The platform claims to guarantee a significant increase in overall programmatic revenue.
2. **Unified Data**: Mth Sense aggregates data from various demand partners into a single reporting interface, simplifying analytics and decision-making.
3. **Automated Tag Management**: It automates the creation and management of ad tags, which streamlines operations for publishers and reduces everyday hassles in ad management.

**By the Numbers**  
- **100 billion** impressions optimized  
- **36%** average increase in revenue reported by users  
- Over **100 publishers** on the platform  

**The Team**  
Mth Sense is a lean operation with a team of 11 dedicated employees, all working together to push the boundaries of ad tech. Although specific partnerships are not disclosed, they have a robust group partner network to enhance their capabilities.

**Tags**: Their core focus areas include **privacy**, **advertising**, and improving efficiencies within the **San Francisco Bay Area** digital landscape.

**Conclusion**  
In a world flooded with automated ad solutions, Mth Sense stands out by putting the power of machine learning and automation directly into the hands of publishers. Their approach to giving advertisers a clearer view into their demographic targeting capabilities—while ensuring profitability—could redefine how brands connect with their audiences. If you're involved in programmatic advertising or looking to enhance your ad revenue, it's worth checking out what Mth Sense has to offer on their [website](http://www.mthsense.com/).

KubeSail is the home hosting company.

We make it easy to take back your privacy, fix the internet, and de-google all at once: host apps at home!

Plug in a spare PC or buy our custom home-hosting hardware https://pibox.io, install apps like PhotoPrism, NocoDB, and Minecraft, and enjoy complete ownership of your data. We build everything you need to make hosting at home viable and fun.

For companies, we make it easy to deploy software on-demand for your customers (either in the cloud, or by physically shipping them pre-configured hardware) to your users. Companies like ChatWoot use KubeSail Platform to deploy instances of their software dynamically, the moment a user pays.
metadata.generated_description:
### KubeSail: The Self-Hosting Company

Founded in 2018 and part of Y Combinator's S19 batch, KubeSail is stirring up the self-hosting revolution from Pasadena, California. With just a two-person team, the company operates under a clear mission: to empower users to reclaim their privacy by hosting applications at home. They’re not just a tech company; they’re advocates for a more accountable internet.

#### What They Offer

KubeSail simplifies self-hosting, making it accessible and enjoyable. Whether you plug in a spare PC or invest in their custom-designed hardware, known as the PiBox, you can install a variety of apps—think PhotoPrism for photos, NocoDB for database management, or even Minecraft for gaming. This gives you total control over your data, elevating personal and organizational privacy.

For businesses, KubeSail is a game-changer. They provide rapid, on-demand software deployment—whether in the cloud or through physical, pre-configured servers. Companies like ChatWoot leverage KubeSail to dynamically deliver software to paying users, streamlining operations in real-time.

#### Why Self-Host?

Let’s break down the allure of self-hosting:
1. **Ownership**: You're in control of your data without relying on third-party clouds.
2. **Customization**: Choose from a wide range of self-hosted applications, creating a personalized tech ecosystem.
3. **Accessibility**: Access your hosted applications from anywhere, mimicking the benefits of paid cloud services without the hefty bills.

KubeSail's offerings include comprehensive support, educational resources, and a commitment to making self-hosting beginner-friendly and powerful.

#### Pricing Structure

KubeSail has a tiered pricing model catering to different needs:
- **Free Tier**: Good for beginners wanting to dip their toes in self-hosting.
- **Standard Plan**: At $7 per month, it includes custom domains and tech support.
- **Business Plan**: Starting at $49, this tier is tailored for more extensive operations, featuring dedicated support and the ability to ship plug-and-play hardware.

Each plan aims to deliver value while respecting your right to privacy and ownership of your digital environment.

#### In Summary

KubeSail isn't just about hosting; it's a movement advocating for data ownership in an era dominated by corporate cloud giants. With a strong emphasis on community, support, and education, KubeSail empowers individuals and organizations to take back control with fun, flexible self-hosting solutions. Their commitment is clear: they want to help you “fix the internet” and de-google your life—all while enjoying the process. 

To dive into hosting on your own terms, check out their offerings at [kubesail.com](https://kubesail.com) and discover a world where you control your data instead of the other way around.
metadata.headline: The Self-Hosting Company

metadata.description:
Instead of just links, Andi gives you answers - like chatting with a smart friend. 

Andi is a new type of search engine that uses generative AI and language models combined with live data to generate factually correct answers to questions, and to explain and summarize information combined from the best sources. 

Andi works as a search chatbot that's ad-free and privacy-focused. Ask Andi to...

✅  Answer questions
🧠  Find, summarize and explain information
🔍  Navigate and search the web

Search is broken because of SEO spam, ads, and surveillance capitalism. Andi cuts through the clutter to get you straight to the knowledge you need. It presents results visually in a way that's easy to understand with a simple chat interface, and protects you from ad tech and distraction.
metadata.founder_1_description: Angela (CEO) is from a totally non-traditional founder background. She's a community college dropout who went from construction laborer to working with Microsoft on Azure, before launching Angie's Travels, a travel influencer startup. She started Andi after going through YC Startup School as a 23-year-old non-technical female founder with the idea for a "not searching" engine for Gen-Z.
metadata.founder_2_description: Jed (CTO) has been programming since he was 8, and sold his first software aged 12. He studied computer science (USyd-part/USFCA), and was editor-in-chief of Australia's top computer magazine at 23, before making a popular start page with 3m users, and building a media search and personalization startup. He has 20+ years experience in search and AI.
metadata.generated_description:
### Andi: The Future of Search

**Overview**  
Andi is a search engine reimagined. Founded in 2021 and initially backed by Y Combinator's W22 batch, Andi leverages the latest advancements in generative AI to transform how we find information online. Based in San Francisco, it operates with a small, focused team of two, including a group partner named Nan.

**Mission**  
Andi's mission is straightforward: "Search for the next generation using generative AI." This reflects its commitment to providing a user-friendly, intelligent search experience—like having a conversation with a knowledgeable friend rather than sifting through links and ads.

**What Makes Andi Unique?**  
Traditional search engines often drown users in SEO-optimized spam, intrusive ads, and endless tracking. Andi cuts through this clutter. Here’s how:
- **Chat-Based Interface**: Andi operates as a chatbot, allowing users to ask questions naturally and receive concise, accurate answers.
- **Privacy-Focused**: There are no ads or tracking. Your queries remain your own.
- **Visual Results**: Information is presented in a visually appealing and digestible format, making it easier to understand complex topics.

**Core Features**  
- ✅ **Instant Answers**: Ask Andi anything, from "how to lose belly fat" to "best places for digital nomads," and get reliable, succinct responses.
- 🧠 **Information Summarization**: Andi can find, summarize, and explain information from the best sources available, enhancing your understanding of any subject.
- 🔍 **Web Navigation**: With Andi, you can navigate the web more efficiently, sidestepping the usual distractions found in traditional search engines.

**The Verdict**  
Andi is a refreshing take on search, aiming to enhance the user experience with cutting-edge AI while prioritizing privacy and simplicity. If you're fed up with endless scrolling and irrelevant ads, Andi might just be the smarter, more efficient solution you've been looking for. 

Check it out at [Andi's Website](https://andisearch.com) and experience search like never before.
metadata.headline: Search for the next generation using generative AI
metadata.name: Andi

### Filta: The Future of Face Filters and Digital Fashion

**Overview**  
Filta is disrupting the face filter landscape by creating a dedicated NFT marketplace specifically for digital makeup and filters. Founded in 2021 and based in San Francisco, Filta is a brainchild of industry veterans from Pixar, Oculus, and Facebook. It's backed by Y Combinator as part of the S21 batch, highlighting its innovative approach and potential in the digital space.

**Mission**  
The primary aim of Filta is to empower independent artists who create the popular face filters we see on social platforms. Typically, these creators don’t receive fair compensation for their work. Filta changes that by providing them with a robust platform to sell limited-edition filters, ensuring they get the recognition—and revenue—they deserve.

**What Filta Offers**  
Filta provides multiple features for both users and artists:
- **Digital Makeup**: Users can apply filters for video calls or social media with just a click.
- **Streaming Enhancements**: Filta allows influencers and streamers to monetize their content through interactive filters controlled by viewer donations.
- **Privacy Filters**: For those who value anonymity, there are filters designed to protect your identity online.
- **NFT Integration**: Users can showcase their favorite NFTs as wearable filters, tapping into the booming NFT trend.
- **Avatars and Virtual Wear**: Filta also caters to gamers and digital creators by providing filters of popular avatars.

**How It Works**  
Using Filta is straightforward:
1. **Discover**: Browse the Filta Marketplace for new and trending filters created by artists.
2. **Collect**: Users can claim their favorite filters to add to their collection.
3. **Wear**: Through the Filta app, users can easily wear and share their selected filters on video calls or social media.

**Supported Platforms**  
Filta caters to a variety of platforms, making it versatile for different types of content creation:
- **Video Chat**: Zoom, Microsoft Teams, Google Meet, Discord
- **Social Media**: TikTok, Instagram, Snapchat, Facebook
- **Streaming**: OBS, Twitch, YouTube Live

**Team and Culture**  
With a lean team of just 3 employees, Filta thrives on collaboration and a startup ethos. If you're passionate about augmented reality and web3 technologies, they're actively hiring.

**Conclusion**  
Filta is not just a tool—it's a movement toward recognizing and rewarding creativity in the digital fashion space. By placing artists at the forefront and providing innovative tools for users, Filta is well-poised to define the future of augmented reality and digital identity. If you're interested in this fascinating intersection of art and technology, take a look at their offerings and consider joining their community. To learn more, visit [getfilta.com](http://www.getfilta.com).

Yezza makes it easy for small businesses in SE Asia to create storefronts on WhatsApp. Our MRR is $40K with $3M monthly GMV, from 1500 orders every day. We are profitable.

Not only for selling goods & products, Yezza also built features to fit with many use cases in WhatsApp Commerce. For example, social media influencers use Yezza to deal with brands using WhatsApp. We found that customers also make table reservations through WhatsApp.

Merchants pay us $12 per month & up to $0.25 per order. With 50M WhatsApp Business downloads in SE Asia, this creates a $7.2B market opportunity. Interestingly, a similar buying-via-WhatsApp behavior exists in Latin America & Africa.

Previously, we bootstrapped a tech-enabled travel company to $12M in annual revenue, by selling travel packages using WhatsApp. We built & used this product for 4 years in our previous company. During COVID19, we offshoot it to become a standalone business called Yezza.

Take App aims to be the Shopify of WhatsApp commerce, focusing on making e-commerce through WhatsApp intuitive and accessible. They simplify the ordering process, empowering customers to place orders independently, thereby enhancing the overall shopping experience.

### Key Features & Services
- **WhatsApp Ordering:** Customers can place orders via a user-friendly WhatsApp order form.
- **Order Management:** Businesses can easily track order status, manage invoices, and receive notifications.
- **Payment Methods:** Accepts various local payment options, including QR codes, credit/debit cards, and cash on delivery.
- **Business Tools:** Provides features like inventory management, customer relationship management (CRM), and analytics to optimize sales performance.
- **Customizable Websites:** Businesses can create beautiful product catalogs and websites tailored to their needs, ensuring a seamless digital presence.

### Target Market
Take App caters primarily to small businesses looking to leverage the popularity of WhatsApp for sales while avoiding complex setups and excessive transaction fees commonly found in traditional e-commerce platforms.

### Pricing Structure
- **Basic Plan:** Free forever for hobbyists, offering unlimited WhatsApp orders.
- **Premium Plan:** $14 per month for solo entrepreneurs, including additional features such as analytics and payment processing.
- **Business Plan:** $38 per month for teams, which includes more extensive capabilities like shared team inboxes and custom APIs.

### Customer Experience
Take App has received positive feedback from users, who praise its ease of use and the smooth experience it provides in managing orders and payments. Customers appreciate the reduction in platform juggling, thanks to Take App's all-in-one approach.

### Conclusion
Take App stands out in the e-commerce space by tapping into the familiarity and convenience of WhatsApp commerce. Led by a skilled founder, it offers small businesses a simplified, effective way to engage with customers and drive sales without complicated maneuvers. If you're looking for a way to streamline your orders on WhatsApp, this could be the tool you need.
metadata.headline: Shopify for WhatsApp commerce
metadata.name: Take App

metadata.generated_description:
Ahazou is a Brazilian startup that serves as a digital marketing platform for local businesses in Latin America. Founded in 2017 and part of Y Combinator's S21 batch, Ahazou has quickly gained traction, boasting over 16,000 subscribers and reaching $100,000 in monthly recurring revenue (MRR). 

At its core, Ahazou is a SaaS application designed to bridge the gap between offline local businesses and their customers online. The mission is clear: create a comprehensive platform that empowers 50 million local businesses in Latin America to grow and thrive in an increasingly digital world. 

The company is led by Rui Miadaira, a seasoned entrepreneur with a tech background and a Harvard MBA, alongside a team that brings experience from major players like iFood, Movile, and PicPay. This diverse expertise helps drive innovation and user-friendliness in their offerings. 

Ahazou specializes in providing ready-made content for social media, complete with posts, stories, videos, and captions tailored for various industries—from beauty and wellness to automotive and real estate. Their app features over 350,000 unique content pieces, designed by professionals, which users can personalize with their branding in just three minutes. This accessibility democratizes high-quality content creation, saving users time and money compared to traditional agencies or freelancers.

The platform's subscription model is competitively priced, promising unlimited access to content without the constraints of watermarks or hidden fees. Their Prime and Pro plans cater to different business needs, enhancing user engagement and visibility across social media platforms.

Supported by well-respected investors—including GFC, Monashees, and Y Combinator—Ahazou is strategically positioned to scale its impact. With a strong team and an expanding user base, the company aims not just to be a tool, but a fundamental partner for local businesses seeking online presence and growth.

For more about their services, you can visit their website [Ahazou.com](https://ahazou.com).

### Company Overview: Makrwatch

By acting as an alternative to traditional digital ad networks like Google and Facebook, Makrwatch enables brands to reach their audiences at a more efficient cost while acquiring high-quality, engaged customers.

**Background**: Founded in 2017 and part of Y Combinator Batch W15, Makrwatch has experienced explosive growth, reporting 100%+ year-over-year increases. Currently, they process between $2M and $5M in billings and collaborate with creators across over 60 countries. With a fully remote team of 20 members spanning six countries, their objectives include reaching $20M in billings and facilitating 10,000 sponsored videos within the next 18 months.

**Team & Location**: Located in New York, the company's 20 diverse team members contribute to a vibrant creator-focused ecosystem. Their Group Partner is nan.

**Core Services**: Makrwatch operates as a technology-based influencer marketing agency that connects brands with YouTube creators. They offer services that streamline everything from negotiations to contracting, making partnership logistics easy for both brands and creators. Creators can get pitched directly to brands, manage sponsorship contracts, and receive support for content pricing and representation.

**Growth & Vision**: The roadmap for Makrwatch is ambitious yet achievable. With their current trajectory, they aim to solidify their position as a leading influencer marketing agency that not only boosts brand visibility but also nurtures creator relationships.

**Website**: For more information and to explore partnership opportunities, visit [Makrwatch's website](https://www.makrwatch.com).

**Key Tags**: Marketplace, B2B, Social Media, Advertising, Creator Economy, New York.

### Conclusion

In a world where influencer marketing is becoming more significant, Makrwatch has positioned itself as a crucial player. Their focus on efficiency and quality makes them an attractive avenue for brands looking to expand beyond traditional advertising methods, while also providing creators with valuable opportunities to grow their partnerships and income. If you’re a brand seeking innovative ways to connect with your audience or a creator looking for sponsorship, Makrwatch is worth exploring.

metadata.description:
Hubla is the Shopify for creators, enabling anyone to build, manage, and grow their online business. We provide powerful tools to create courses, communities, sell products, manage memberships, and deliver content—all in one platform. For example, a fitness coach can charge her audience for a unique digital weight-loss program, turning passion into profit.

Creators need simple, flexible tools to succeed. Hubla’s fully customizable platform lets them own their strategy, stand out from competitors, and create unique experiences. This approach works—our top creator earns over $8M annually.

Hubla is leading the creator economy revolution, empowering individuals to transform their expertise into sustainable, scalable businesses.
metadata.founder_1_description: Software engineer and product design.
metadata.founder_2_description: Breno is co-founder of Hubla (YCombinator S20). Breno has a large experience (since 1993) in product and software development. He was the creator of nFlog (2004) converting more than 15k users in the first month. His project RemotePark, app for finding parking lot available nearby, gave him the StartupFarm award in 2011. Breno also was co-founder of RBM Solutions, a performance marketing company, the first using pay per install (PPI) in Brazil.
metadata.founder_3_description:
Always looking for a better way to solve real life problem with software, I'm passionate about creating tools and services that improve people's lives. To do that I'm always looking for the techinical knowledge to create and use good architectures so that systems can grow in a healthy way.

I am an Android, but I also have a wide experience in developing servers in Kotlin, Java and Python. I have also used Flutter for Android and iOS applications and React for web apps.
